meanings.definition: Unable to be dissolved or undone.
meanings.sent1: Their friendship was indissoluble, lasting through thick and thin.
meanings.sent2: The bond between the two siblings was indissoluble, unbreakable by any disagreement.
meanings.sent3: The indissoluble glue held the pieces together so well that even a tornado couldn't separate them.
meanings.sent4: The indissoluble connection between the two lovers was like a chain that could not be broken.
meanings.sent5: The indissoluble marriage vow they made was as strong as steel, binding them forever.

meanings.sent1: The foundation of the building was indissoluble, ensuring its stability during earthquakes.
meanings.sent2: Her decision to pursue her dream was indissoluble, unwavering despite any obstacles.
meanings.sent3: The indissoluble tree stood tall in the storm, refusing to be swayed by the strong winds.
meanings.sent4: His indissoluble belief in justice was like a rock in the face of corruption.
meanings.sent5: The indissoluble commitment of the team members ensured their success, no matter the challenges they faced.
